definitions.definition: To favor in a decision.

A lightweight helmet-shaped hat made of the pith of the sola or shola (Indian spongewood) plant covered with white cotton and faced with green cloth. Also known as a "sola topi", it was originally used by the British army in India in the 19th century, later used more widely.
A hat of similar appearance, but made of different materials.
A strip of metal, whalebone, wood, or other material, worn in the front of a corset to stiffen it.
(by extension) A corset.
A kind of linen.
To prepare; to make ready; to array; to dress.
To go; to direct one's course.
To solicit money by entertaining the public in the street or in public transport
To tack, cruise about.
One who advocates liberty, either generally or in relation to a specific issue.
definitions.example: civil libertarian

definitions.definition: A believer in a political doctrine that emphasizes individual liberty and a lack of governmental regulation, intervention, and oversight both in matters of the economy (‘free market’) and in personal behavior where no one’s rights are being violated or threatened; also, a ‘classical liberal’, akin to an ‘anarcho-capitalist’.
A left-libertarian, an antiauthoritarian believer in both individual freedom and social justice (social equality and mutual aid), such as a social anarchist.
A believer in the freedom of thinking beings to choose their own destiny, i.e. a believer in free will as opposed to those who believe the future is predetermined.
Having the beliefs of libertarians; having a relative tendency towards liberty.
definitions.example: A libertarian capitalist.

definitions.definition: Relating to liberty, or to the doctrine of free will, as opposed to the doctrine of necessity.
A post on a highway, often with one or more fingerposts, showing the distance in miles to nearby places
A sign or post beside a railway marking the distance from the (actual or nominal) start of a line (usually the principal terminus or junction with a more major line)
To place mileposts along (a road, etc.).
Preparation for the future; good governance, foresight.
The careful governance and guidance of God (or another deity, nature etc.).
A manifestation of divine care or direction; an instance of divine intervention.
Specifically, the prudent care and management of resources; thriftiness, frugality.
definitions.example: His providence in saving for his old age is exemplary.

definitions.definition: The state or condition of being a surrogate.
The practice of being a surrogate mother.
Someone who practices mysticism.
Of, or relating to mystics, mysticism or occult mysteries; mystical.
definitions.example: a mystic dance

definitions.definition: Mysterious and strange; arcane, obscure or enigmatic.
A species of small parakeet native to Australia and often kept as pets, Melopsittacus undulatus.
That which was stated before, the aforesaid, the above, the same, likewise.
A duplicate or copy of a document, particularly one created by a spirit duplicator.
definitions.example: Please run off twenty-four dittos of this assignment, for my students.

definitions.definition: A copy; an imitation.
A symbol, represented by two apostrophes, inverted commas, or quotation marks (" "), when indicating that the item preceding is to be repeated.
(in the plural) A suit of clothes of the same colour throughout.
To repeat the aforesaid, the earlier action etc.
As said before, likewise.
Used as an expression of agreement with what another person has said, or to indicate that what they have said equally applies to the person being addressed.
To deny (a person or organisation) the use of platforms (newspaper columns, speaking engagements, etc) to publish their opinions, etc.
The peak or crest of a hill.
A dog of a particular breed, similar in shape to a greyhound but with longer silkier hair.
The small, bitter, wild fruit of the blackthorn (Prunus spinosa).
The tree Prunus spinosa.
Any of various other plants of the genus Prunus, as a shrub or small tree, Prunus alleghaniensis, bearing dark-purple fruit.
Without pause.
definitions.example: The river continuously flows to the sea, it will never pause to let us cross on dry land.

definitions.definition: Food in the form of a soft paste, often a porridge, especially as given to very young children.
definitions.example: Pap can be made from bread boiled in milk or water.

definitions.definition: Nonsense.
Porridge.
Support from official patronage.
definitions.example: Treasury pap

definitions.definition: The pulp of fruit.
To feed with pap.
Spineless, wet, without character.
definitions.example: He is so pap and boring.

definitions.definition: A female breast or nipple.
A man's breast.
A rounded, nipple-like hill or peak.
Pap smear
(South African slang) Flat.
definitions.example: I got a puncture and the wheel went pap.

definitions.definition: A paparazzo.
(usually in the passive) Of a paparazzo, to take a surreptitious photograph of (someone, especially a celebrity) without their consent.
definitions.example: Look, that pop star’s been papped in her bikini again!

definitions.definition: Pa; father
Freshly fallen, uncompacted snow, especially in the context of Alpine skiing
definitions.example: Expert skiers love skiing on powder snow.

definitions.definition: Very hot and dry.
Full of intense emotions arising from sexual love; ardent and passionate.
definitions.example: a torrid love scene in a film or novel

definitions.definition: Full of difficulty.
Any of various economic and political theories advocating collective or governmental ownership and administration of the means of production and distribution of goods.
The intermediate phase of social development between capitalism and communism in Marxist theory in which the state has control of the means of production.
Any left-wing ideology, government regulations, or policies promoting a welfare state, nationalisation, etc.
Fruitless, futile, useless.
An unpredictable thing.
Unable to be predicted.
A period of time consisting of one thousand years.
The period of one thousand years during which Christ will reign on earth (according to Millenarianist interpretations).
A period of universal happiness, peace or prosperity; a utopia.
(with definite article) The year in which one period of one thousand years ends and another begins, especially the year 2000.
(color) A greenish-blue color.
Any of various lycaenid butterflies of the genus Jamides.
Sky-blue.
A lightweight waterproof parka.
A short jump.
definitions.example: The frog crossed the brook in three or four hops.

definitions.definition: A jump on one leg.
A short journey, especially in the case of air travel, one that take place on private plane.
A bounce, especially from the ground, of a thrown or batted ball.
A dance; a gathering for the purpose of dancing.
The sending of a data packet from one host to another as part of its overall journey.
To jump a short distance.
To jump on one foot.
To be in state of energetic activity.
definitions.example: Sorry, can't chat. Got to hop.

definitions.definition: To suddenly take a mode of transportation that one does not drive oneself, often surreptitiously.
definitions.example: He hopped a train to California.

definitions.definition: To jump onto, or over
(usually in combination) To move frequently from one place or situation to another similar one.
definitions.example: We had to island hop on the weekly seaplane to get to his hideaway.

definitions.definition: To walk lame; to limp.
To dance.
The plant (Humulus lupulus) from whose flowers, beer or ale is brewed.
(usually in the plural) The flowers of the hop plant, dried and used to brew beer etc.
Opium, or some other narcotic drug.
The fruit of the dog rose; a hip.
To impregnate with hops, especially to add hops as a flavouring agent during the production of beer
To gather hops.
To become a part of a group; to incorporate (someone) into a group.
To begin to use a product or service; to take (someone) on as a new customer of a product or service.
Carried or used on or in a vehicle or vessel
(by extension) Being a part of, being included in, participating in
definitions.example: James is onboard as a production manager.

definitions.definition: On or in a vehicle or vessel; aboard; on board.
Lack of interruption or disconnection; the quality of being continuous in space or time.
definitions.example: Considerable continuity of attention is needed to read German philosophy.

definitions.definition: A characteristic property of a continuous function.
A narrative device in episodic fiction where previous and/or future events in a series of stories are accounted for in present stories.
Consistency between multiple shots depicting the same scene but possibly filmed on different occasions.
The announcements and messages inserted by the broadcaster between programmes.
A military officer in the armies of most nations, typically ranking below a lieutenant general and above a brigadier.
A person who is absent from his or her employment, school, post, duty, etc.
A landholder who lives in another district or country than the one in which his estate is situated.
One that is nonexistent or lacking.
A voter that is not present at the time of voting; absentee voter.
Pertaining to one that is absent.
A birdwatcher.
A person who hunts birds.
A colourant, especially one that has an affinity to the substrate to which it is applied.
Any hue, color, or blee.
To colour with dye, or as if with dye.
A regular polyhedron, usually a cube, with numbers or symbols on each side and used in games of chance.
That which is, or might be, determined, by a throw of the die; hazard; chance.
(plural also dies) An oblong chip fractured from a semiconductor wafer engineered to perform as an independent device or integrated circuit.
The cubical part of a pedestal; a plinth.
A device for cutting into a specified shape.
A device used to cut an external screw thread. (Internal screw threads are cut with a tap.)
A mold for forming metal or plastic objects.
An embossed device used in stamping coins and medals.
(plural also dice) An oblong chip fractured from a semiconductor wafer engineered to perform as an independent device or integrated circuit.
Any small cubical or square body.
A colourant, especially one that has an affinity to the substrate to which it is applied.
Any hue, color, or blee.
A machine used for the application of capital punishment by decapitation, consisting of a tall upright frame from which is suspended a heavy diagonal-edged blade.
A device used for cutting stacks of paper to straight edges, usually by means of a hinged blade attached to a flat platform.
A cloture; a motion that debate be ended and a vote taken.
A surgical instrument for cutting the tonsils.
To execute, cut or cut short (a person, a stack of paper or a debate) by use of a guillotine.
To end discussion on a parliamentary bill by invoking cloture.
An oral examination.
By word of mouth.
By word of mouth.
One who shops very frequently.
definitions.example: Shopaholics lose a lot of their money and possibly go broke because they've spent all of it.

definitions.definition: Common term applied to someone suffering from oniomania.
A disputed issue or state of affairs that causes an interruption or outright impasse in progress towards some goal or resolution, especially in negotiation or argumentation.
The point at which a process or thing, especially a state of mind or emotion, reaches its greatest strength and remains steadfast; sticking-place.
An inexpensive diner or other informal restaurant, especially one specializing in frying or grilling.
definitions.example: We found a good little greasy spoon down a side street.

definitions.definition: The person who drives the engine of a train.
A two-word verb, consisting of a verb and a "small" adverb, that has an idiomatic meaning not easily predictable from the individual parts.
definitions.example: In 'The police told the driver to pull over', 'pull over' is a phrasal verb.

definitions.definition: (more loosely) A phrase, consisting of a verb and either or both of a preposition or adverb, that has idiomatic meaning.
Without any clouds.
Something displeasing; anything that is disagreeable.
Not agreeable, conformable, or congruous; contrary; unsuitable.
Exciting repugnance; offensive to the feelings or senses; displeasing; unpleasant.
A double feature.
The consecutive presentation of two episodes of a television series.
To charge twice for a good or service.
A small landing place for helicopters, denoted by a large "H".
A cut of meat suited to roasting
A meal consisting of roast foods.
The degree to which something, especially coffee, is roasted.
definitions.example: Dark roast means that the coffee bean has been roasted to a higher temperature and for a longer period of time than in light roast.

definitions.definition: A comical event, originally fraternal, where a person is subjected to verbal attack, yet may be praised by sarcasm and jokes.
To cook food by heating in an oven or over a fire without covering, resulting in a crisp, possibly even slightly charred appearance.
definitions.example: to roast meat on a spit

definitions.definition: To cook by surrounding with hot embers, ashes, sand, etc.
definitions.example: to roast a potato in ashes

definitions.definition: To process by drying through exposure to sun or artificial heat
definitions.example: Coffee beans need roasting before use.

definitions.definition: To heat to excess; to heat violently; to burn.
To admonish someone vigorously
definitions.example: I’m late home for the fourth time this week; my mate will really roast me this time.

definitions.definition: To subject to bantering, severely criticize, sometimes as a comedy routine.
definitions.example: The class clown enjoys being roasted by mates as well as staff.

definitions.definition: To dissipate by heat the volatile parts of, as ores.
Having been cooked by roasting.
Subjected to roasting, bantered, severely criticized.
The fruit or seed of leguminous plants (as peas or beans) used for food.

Any of a large family (Fabaceae, syn. Leguminosae) of dicotyledonous herbs, shrubs, and trees having fruits that are legumes or loments, bearing nodules on the roots that contain nitrogen-fixing bacteria, and including important food and forage plants (as peas, beans, or clovers).
A pod dehiscent into two pieces or valves, and having the seed attached at one suture, as that of the pea.
A swimming stroke in which the swimmer lies face down, the arms being swept forward, outward and back under the water and the legs are kicked like a frog's
To swim using this stroke
Interference on a broadcast signal caused by atmospheric disturbances; heard as crackles on radio, or seen as random specks on television.
(by extension) Interference or obstruction from people.
Static electricity.
A static caravan.
Verbal abuse.
A static variable.
Unchanging; that cannot or does not change.
Immobile; fixed in place; having no motion.
Computed, created or allocated before the program starts running, and usually not changeable at runtime
Defined for the class itself, as opposed to instances of it; thus shared between all instances and accessible even without an instance.
To pack or bundle something.
To travel on a package holiday.
To prepare (a book, a television series, etc.), including all stages from research to production, in order to sell the result to a publisher or broadcaster.
The act of packing something.
The materials used to pack something.
The industry that produces such material.
(by extension) The manner in which a person or product is promoted.
Made by a tailor, especially if made to order; bespoke
Perfectly appropriate to some specific occasion or purpose; made to one's specific requirements
To customize or create specifically to meet the requirements of an individual.
To make (clothes) by a tailor.
A bluish-green pigment made from chromium sesquioxide.
(color) A bluish-green color.
(colour) Of a bluish green colour.
An act of uprooting and moving (something).
Anything that is transplanted.
An operation in which tissue or an organ is transplanted.
A transplanted organ or tissue.
Someone who is not native to their area of residence.
To uproot (a growing plant), and plant it in another place.
To remove (something) and establish its residence in another place; to resettle or relocate.
To transfer (tissue or an organ) from one body to another, or from one part of a body to another.
An impressively forceful dunk.
A task expected to present no difficulty, a piece of cake.
definitions.example: As long as you get the vice president's approval first, it'll be a slam dunk.

definitions.definition: (yachting) Tacking on top of the wind of the following yacht in close quarters
To perform a slam dunk.
A public telephone that accepts prepaid cards rather than coins.
A person who is paid to lobby politicians and encourage them to vote a certain way or otherwise use their office to effect a desired result.
The quality of being poignant
Something that surrounds; encompassing material, substance or shape.
The atmosphere; the surrounding air or sky; atmospheric components collectively such as air, clouds, water vapour, hail, etc.
A type of modern music that creates a relaxing and peaceful atmosphere.
Encompassing on all sides; surrounding; encircling; enveloping.
definitions.example: A cup of tea eventually cools to the ambient temperature.

definitions.definition: Evoking or creating an atmosphere: atmospheric.
Relating to, or suitable for, storage at room temperature.
definitions.example: ambient food

definitions.definition: Containing objects or describing a setting that one is interested in.
Of, pertaining to, or in the capacity of a supervisor
A capacious, flat-bottomed drinking cup, generally with four handles, formerly used for passing around the table at convivial entertainment.
The children's game of tag.
A nonvenomous snake, Natrix natrix, native to Europe, with a yellow collar.
The two species of the nonvenomous green snake, Opheodrys, of North America:
A dead body; especially the corpse of a human to be dissected.
A small anvil-shaped bone in the middle ear.
An accessory cloud, in the shape of an anvil which forms by spreading at the top of a cumulonimbus.
A person suffering from apoplexy.
Of, or relating to apoplexy.
Marked by extreme anger or fury.
Effused with blood.
The state of being a father.
Any natural number greater than 1 that cannot be formed by multiplying two smaller natural numbers.
definitions.example: The fundamental theorem of arithmetic states that every natural number greater than 1 can be factorized into prime numbers in a way that is unique up to the order in which the factors are written.

definitions.definition: Any natural number (including 1) that is divisible only by itself and 1.
The Chinese tropical fruit tree Litchi chinensis, of the soapberry family.
That tree's bright red oval fruit with a single stone surrounded by a fleshy white aril.
A soft pink-red colour, like that of a lychee rind (also called lychee red).
A rule regarding play on a specific field, course, or court.
(usually in the plural) The basic rules or standards; whatever someone must know before proceeding.
definitions.example: Make sure everybody knows the ground rules for the trip before they leave.

definitions.definition: An unborn or unhatched vertebrate showing signs of the mature animal.
A human embryo after the eighth week of gestation.
definitions.example: The sequence is: molecules in reproductive systems, then gametes, zygotes, morulas, blastocysts, and then fetuses.

definitions.definition: A musical style characteristic of the 16th and 17th centuries.
A moderately slow, courtly processional dance in duple time/meter.
A wheeled chair for the transport of a baby or infant.
A classified advertisement describing an individual who wishes to find a marriage partner.
Of, or having to do with matrimony and marriage.
Evaluate again; reassess; revisit; reconsider.
definitions.example: The long hours and poor working conditions led him to re-evaluate his job.

definitions.definition: A policy of protecting and informing consumers through honesty in advertising and packaging, improved safety standards etc
A materialistic attachment to possessions.
An economic theory that increased consumption is beneficial to a nation's economy in the long run.
A fierce attack.
A large number of people or things resembling an attack.
definitions.example: They opened the doors and prepared for the onslaught of holiday shoppers.

definitions.definition: An undesirable person
Objectionable or not likely to please
Ambiguous; liable to more than one interpretation.
Not clearly or explicitly defined.
Not easy to see or read; indecipherable or unreadable.
Not having a clear idea; uncertain.
definitions.example: I'm still unclear about what she meant by that remark.

definitions.definition: A tactic used to draw attention away from the real threat or action.
A hobby; an activity that distracts the mind.
The act of diverting.
Removal of water via a canal.
A detour, such as during road construction.
The rerouting of cargo or passengers to a new transshipment point or destination, or to a different mode of transportation before arrival at the ultimate destination.
Officially halting or suspending a formal criminal or juvenile justice proceeding and referral of the accused person to a treatment or care program.
A rhotic consonant or rhotic vowel (R-coloured vowel).
(of an English accent) That allows the phoneme /ɹ/ even when not followed by a vowel, as in bar (/bɑːɹ/) and bard or barred (/bɑːɹd/); (of an English speaker) who speaks with such an accent.
definitions.example: Rhotic speech is common in Ireland, Scotland, much of the United States, Canada, West Country England, and many parts of the north and west of England.

definitions.definition: (of a phoneme) Having a sound quality associated with the letter R; having the sound of any of certain IPA symbols, including /ɹ/, /ɻ/, /ɚ/, /ɝ/ and /r/.
definitions.example: In the IPA, a rhotic vowel (aka R-coloured vowel, retroflex vowel, vocalic r or rhotacised vowel) is indicated by the affixing of a hook diacritic ( ˞ ) to the right of the regular symbol for the vowel. The rhotic consonants are /r/,  /ɾ/, /ɹ/, /ɻ/, /ʀ/, /ʁ/, /ɽ/ and /ɺ/.

definitions.definition: Somewhat yellow (in colour).
The act of occupying, the state of being occupied or the state of being an occupant or tenant.
The period of time during which someone rents or otherwise occupies certain land or premises.
definitions.example: They had a five-year occupancy on the house.

definitions.definition: The specific use to which something occupied is put.
definitions.example: This building is for residential occupancy.

definitions.definition: The age at which a person is legally considered to be mature enough to engage willingly in sexual intercourse, so that it is not a crime for someone else to have sex with the person.
definitions.example: In France the age of consent is 15 years of age.

definitions.definition: Someone who votes.
definitions.example: In your opinion, should we allow 16 and 17 year olds to become voters?
